title: Better nerf urgot then TWITCH!
body: Riot Balance Team at its best... Urgot doesnt Need nerfs he is slow as hell, meanwhile twitch one shotting everyone from stealth

replies.body:
Yeah not like he has a 54% after they overbuffed him last patch or anything
http://puu.sh/y8oFe/6e78817197.jpg

His playrate is still low. 
It also sucks because champs like Ahri, and Panth can have winrates like that FOR YEARS while having a HIGHER PLAYRATE

Yeah but the difference here is that urgot was already good in soloq last patch and strong enough to be picked in pro play 

And they just made that Urgot even stronger by quite a bit

I do think Riot went overboard with the nerf and isnt targetting the right area, but he does need some form of nerf

Strong last patch?
I don't think that a 48% with such a low playrate, which is mostly his mains, says that he was rather weak in SoloQ.
But at least we're both agreeing that the wrong part of Urgot's kit is being nerfed

This.

I loved Urgot, but Bramble Vest was such an easy item to build to shut him down to oblivion that I stopped. He was a good decent top laner, great duelist, but a bulky bruiser with Thorn basically meant Urgot would suck.  His Q was too clunky, his passive took too long to cool down to be consistent early game, and his ult... didn't need the fire speed buff, honestly, but whatever.

This patch actually make me want to pick him up again because I can do so much more with Urgot now than before and feel like I'm not fucked in a teamfight. And I was spamming the fuck out of Urgot in queue.

He doesn't need a nerf. People just don't know how to play against him yet, and he's honestly weaker in lane than he was before - his Q is just now easier to harass with. Which, while nice, his all-in ability was hit dramatically (2% down from 4% per shotgun blast before 6, whoof) and he's basically punishable any time he's used his W or any time he's fired off his legs, which can no longer be sped up with CDR (which he reaches lower cooldowns than he had before later in the game, but all other times his cooldowns are higher).

He doesn't really need a nerf at all period. Though the one they're giving him I doubt really hurts him very much and seems more like a preparation nerf for the new runes reforged.

His win-rate actually goes up pretty steep (52% at 10 games). For how few people he is mained by, and how unique he is a 48% isnt that bad. Basically where it should have been, and the buff simply has to do with Riot wanting him to have more of a spotlight because he was just reworked.

> [{quoted}](name=Overloadroad,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M36Q9nzT,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-10-27T15:21:03.987+0000)
>
> His playrate is still low. 
> It also sucks because champs like Ahri, and Panth can have winrates like that FOR YEARS while having a HIGHER PLAYRATE

Urgot is overpowered currently. Wait until you meet an Urgot main. Stop making a big deal out of justified nerfs.

So if a Main of a champ is doing well, then the champ is OP? 
Also, maybe you just don't know how the champion works, thus doing terrible trades against him, and immediatley think he's OP

Ahri's winrate is that high because her kit alltogether flows very well, none of her abilities really stand out on their own as highly frustrating to play against, except for her ulti, and changing that is the kind of big change that the live gameplay team doesn't want to make. Those kinds of changes are for the people who get paid to make reworks, like Repertoire, who made Urgot - pretty cool, or gutted assassins, sadface. Another is certainlyt, his champs are a bit too strong but he did the warwick rework and it's barely had a single change, and is very fun to play too.
But they need to sell dem Ahri skins

???

The fact she could even stay above 51% despite AP itemization being pretty bad is just astonishing.

> [{quoted}](name=AngusBoomPants,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M36Q9nzT,comment-id=000200000004000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-28T08:03:56.711+0000)

http://na.op.gg/champion/statistics try actually looking for that information lol its literally on the same page
God forbid we have a single strong juggernaut.
Cho gath
Idk if he counts as a juggernaut, he has a lot of strong cc, and mediocre damage save for his ult. Seems more like a tank to me. Maybe I'm wrong though, haven't payed much attention to him.
He is sort o like garen with more cc damage and better item paths
He is garen except he can be played against players with more than two brain cells

Urgot has gone from not being that good unless you know what you're doing, to being able to crush low elo. Watch it equalize as more people figure out he destroys against melee matchups.

He has the same problems as illaoi which is why you won't see him that much in higher elo. That problem is that you just walk away from him, he's fairly tanky and deals plenty of damage, but he has to be on top of you for the most part to deal that damage, and to maximize it he needs to literally go around you.

His early game also got a hit, so people that can bully him early and ranged champs that just kite and stay away from him can even keep him off of farm.

Certainly not_ that_ overbuffed, people just don't know how to play against him. Also remember that he gets full damage from the reflection from thronmail on each hit during his w even though he's dealing a third of his per hit.

That said, as someone who loves me some urgot, they can increase the cooldown per leg to 3 or 3.5s at lvl 13 and increase the detonation time of his q by .1s It's a little too easy to hit right now even when someone isn't slowed.

Also, how do we know that that photo is urgot, cite sources and to end. It's only been two freaking days. Let people figure it out before you call OP NERF PLZ.
Thornmail barely does damage. Over the entire durration of his w recieving full damage back he will still have half his shield. at least.

True, but is that a problem with urgot, or thornmail?

Urgot has similiar strengths and weaknesses to Illaoi, when the fight comes to them, they can excel, if they have to roam and go for fights, it's harder because it puts the enemies in a better kiting position.

Champions that jump on people for a rotation like panth and Riven struggle because that's what Urgot is best against because he can get a full combo off without any problems and just get a good trade.
Jax is an exception thanks to his ability to dodge autos, including urgots passive.

i wasnt really saying it was a problem with either. just that thornmail and its interaction with urgot isnt going to break him. I dont find him that terribly strong. But I have only played against him 1 time since the buffs.
Uhhhh wasn't Twitch chilling at 54% for awhile with a much higher pick rate? Hell for the past half year or more he was number 1-2 winrate of all ADCs, never dropping below that until this patch.
Urgot has the 11th highest winrate top with a less then 2% pickrate, hes also really easy to deal with tbh. I do not think he needs nerfs.

Twich had over 56% winrate some months ago, then got nerfed a bit. For some weeks it was played less because of the 'nerfFearOmg' fase. When people started to realize that Twich was still broken they returned to play him.
Now he is almost 54% winrate.

Wtf rito.

> [{quoted}](name=JackGarrusxxx,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M36Q9nzT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-27T11:26:19.168+0000)
>
> Twich had over 56% winrate some months ago, then got nerfed a bit. For some weeks it was played less because of the 'nerfFearOmg' fase. When people started to realize that Twich was still broken they returned to play him.
> Now he is almost 54% winrate.
> 
> Wtf rito.

if this is what happens, this is why urgot got nerfed and not twitch. Riot has about a 1-2 patch delay on addressing problems, because it takes that long to correctly asses and test a solution to said problem.

LOL, Twitch has been broken as fuck for wayyyyy more than 1-2 patches. It's been 3 days since the patch went out with Urgot's buffs. It's pretty funny how a short range top juggernaut sees his winrate shoot up to 54% with Riot planning nerfs 3 days later, while an ADC better than every single assassin at assassinating spends patch after patch after patch without any nerf.

54%
Doesn't seem like a game breaker. 
I mean, apparently Sona has more games and has a bigger winrate.

> Doesn't seem like a game breaker.

In low elo picking twich or draven is automatically free win.
In enemy team, obv

> [{quoted}](name=JackGarrusxxx,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=M36Q9nzT,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-27T12:18:33.830+0000)
>
> In low elo picking twich or draven is automatically free win.
> In enemy team, obv

i doubt anyone in low elo can take full advantage of draven unless they are a smurf...
Win rate isn't everything. It's that twitch isn't fun to fight against on top of being an effective pick, hence why people complain. Even me, I hate fighting twitch.
Path and Sona aren't fun either.
Sona's fun... well, s3 Sona was fun. Idk about her recent state.

I think she's fun! :D I know I'm the minority but it's true for me

Really, it's all just about personal taste.
Twitch is sitting around 52% win-rate atm according to any sites I checked. Where are you seeing him up at 54%?

Yeah, it's logical.
First they nerf urgot THEN twitch.
This change is a load of house and bullshit mixed together and severed like it's a chocolate smoothie.

Just because a champion is slow doesn't mean they don't need nerfs...

Base MS is literally just one stat.

***And Twitch and Urgot have the same base MS***
Twitch can increase that MS with a basic ability, he has way more range not even including his ult. Urgot needs to literally be on top of you to deal his damage and you can see him coming.

And Urgot has a dash that's accompanied by hard CC. Your point is what?

And, even if Urgot's MS is typically lower because of items and/or abilities, _that does not mean that he can escape nerfs in any way, shape, or form_. Tristana is slower than Ahri, does that mean she gets to escape nerfs?

MS argument is dumb at this point, it's just a direct comparison, which doesn't feel effective with these two.

I short dash that has .5s wind up time. it's like dodging a thresh hook.

My opinion on if he needs nerfs or not, I play him fairly often, have been for a couple of patches now. The buffs have been great. Honestly, he's in a pretty good spot due to how much counterplay there is available.

That said My recommendation for nerfs on him.

his passive, either add another step so that it hits 2.5s and 8% damage at say level 15. or increase it to 3s or 3.5s cd at lvl 13. They already hit his passive damage before 13 pretty well.

his q, increase the detonation time by .1s, it's a bit too easy to hit now even when someone isn't slowed.

Besides that, he's very kitable, and has similiar strengths and weaknesses as illaoi, which is also quite a strong champion in the right situations.
So apparently bringing up twitch is a valid argument for any nerf riot puts up on the pbe...

urgot sits in the same place illoai does. strong if you decide to stay, but he can't really do anything if you move outside his range. yea melee vs urgot is a pain, but once the team stuff rolls around he falls off aside from ks with his ult lol
nerf azir boyz {{sticker:sg-jinx}}

One thing being strong doesn't mean another isn't. Yes, Urgot may be slow, but you're ignoring his other strengths, and not considering the possibility that maybe his strengths don't out weigh his weakness. Urgot got *a lot* of access to his Shot gun knees late game, I wouldn't say this is a nerf as much as this is a continuation of the power shift his lower CD knees brought.
Urgot needed nerfs and got them, thankfully. Twitch has needed nerfs for ages though, but ya know, Rito loves marksmen to death.
